required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Allium Extracts on the Incidence of Respiratory Infection Symptoms in Healthy Elderly Volunteers
clinical_study.official_title: Study of the Effect of the Consumption of a Combination of Allium Extracts on the Incidence of Symptoms of Respiratory Infections in Healthy Elderly Residents

brief_summary.textblock:
To analyze the efficacy of daily consumption of a combination of garlic and onion extracts on the incidence of respiratory infection symptoms in healthy elderly volunteers living in a residence.
The duration of symptoms and related medication will also be studied.

detailed_description.textblock:
It is a controlled, randomized, double-blind, parallel-group nutritional intervention study.
66 healthy elderly volunteers living in a nursing home will be randomly distributed into 2 equal groups: control group and intervention group.
For 36 weeks the volunteers will take the product immediately after lunch. During that time they will maintain their lifestyle and nutritional habits.
Every 4 weeks, the medical team of the residence will review the cases of respiratory diseases of infectious origin of the volunteers.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)
study_design_info.masking_description: Each volunteer is assigned a "participant number" that will be associated with a pot that will have all the product for the study. The "pot number" is the same as the "participant number". The pot does not indicate which product it is carrying.

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence of respiratory symptoms associated with infections.
primary_outcome.description: It will be reviewed if the volunteer has had any symptoms related to respiratory diseases of infectious origin.

secondary_outcome.description: If the volunteer has had any symptoms related to respiratory diseases of infectious origin, every 4 weeks duration of these symptoms will be reviewed.
If the volunteer has had any symptoms related to respiratory diseases of infectious origin, every 4 weeks treatment applied will be reviewed.

arm_group.description: Microcrystalline cellulose (9892- Capsules®) up to 400 mg.
Garlic concentrated extract plus onion concentrated extract plus microcrystalline cellulose (9892- Capsules®) up to 400 mg.

intervention.description: Garlic extract concentrate (equivalent to 2 garlic cloves) and onion extract concentrate (equivalent to 1 onion).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Live in a nursing home with medical services.
- Accept being vaccinated for the flu.
- Freely accepted to participate in the study and sign the informed consent document.
- Have the consent of the family.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Having any disease that affects the development and results of the study.
- Be unable to understand the study and sign voluntarily and freely the informed consent.
- Have a low expectation of compliance with the study protocol.

overall_official.affiliation: Claret Residence for the Elderly (Granada, Spain).
